thread.title: NHL: Colorado Avalanche surges past Dallas Stars
thread.title_full: NHL: Colorado Avalanche surges past Dallas Stars

author: Associated Press
title: NHL: Colorado Avalanche surges past Dallas Stars
text:
NHL: Colorado Avalanche surges past Dallas Stars Associated Press Posted: 10/10/2015 09:55:58 PM PDT Updated: 10/10/2015 11:56:19 PM PDT saturDAY'S HIGHLIGHTS Avalanche 6, Stars 3: Gabriel Landeskog scored twice in the third period, one 47 seconds after John Mitchell's tiebreaking goal, and Colorado rallied to beat Dallas. Former Shark Antti Niemi stopped 22 of 28 shots for the Stars after his 37-save shutout of Pittsburgh on Thursday night. 
Coyotes 2, Penguins 1: Mike Smith shook off a hard collision to stop 27 shots, Jordan Martinook scored his first career NHL goal, and Arizona withstood a late flurry to beat Pittsburgh. 
Flames 3, Canucks 2: Johnny Gaudreau scored 3:03 into a 3-on-3 overtime and Calgary beat Vancouver. 
Blackhawks 4, Islanders 1: Patrick Kane and rookie Artemi Panarin each had a goal and two assists for Chicago. 
Capitals 5, Devils 3: Alex Ovechkin scored a stunning go-ahead goal early in the third period and set up another, and Washington opened its season with a victory over New Jersey. 
Canadiens 4, Bruins 2: Lars Eller scored two goals as Montreal beat Boston. 
Panthers 7, Flyers 1: Jaromir Jagr and Reilly Smith each scored two goals as Florida dominated its season opener. 
Senators 5, Maple Leafs 4: Mike Hoffman had the decisive goal in the first shootout of the season, sending Ottawa to victory. 
Lightning 4, Sabres 1: Steven Stamkos scored his first goal of the season, helping Tampa Bay defeat Buffalo. -- ASSOCIATED PRESS
